alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mason; Menard; Morgan; Schuyler (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 4:57PM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan, Mason and Menard. In west central Illinois, Cass, Morgan and Schuyler. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen since early this morning. The heaviest rainfall was in the Lincoln area. - Additional rainfall amounts should be less than a quarter inch, but additional runoff will occur next few hours from heavy rains today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Beardstown, Mason City, Virginia, Petersburg, Atlanta, Bluff Springs, Greenview, Chandlerville, Waynesville, Arenzville, Middletown, Hartsburg, Kilbourne, Browning, Oakford, New Holland, Frederick, Lawndale and Newmansville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
